title: Inscribed base of a dedication to Venus Victrix
support:
A small
                                            hexagonal base, with moulding at top and bottom. An oval
                                            cavity is visible in the top surface into which the
                                            original votive statue will have been
                                            inserted.

layout.p:
A Latin text over 10 lines, engraved on the narrow front face
                                        of the base. The engraved face is 8 cm wide by 27.7 cm high.
                                        The majority of the words are run over onto the following
                                        line, with the final letters centred, suggesting that the
                                        visual effect was prioritised over the sense of the words.
                                        The text is large and well spaced in the upper part,
                                        becoming compressed towards the end, with the final lines
                                        overlapping.

handNote.lettering:
Deeply, but rather irregularly cut letters.
                                    Y and T are tall, as is I in line 4; R is closed. Interpuncts in
                                    the form of a comma.

provenanceFound._: Dug up in 1759 in the territory of Paternò (according to Torremuzza).

facsimile.desc: Photograph of front face by students of  Liceo M.M. Lazzaro

keywords: inscribed base of a dedication to venus victrix
